medical_history.chief_complaint: Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and abdominal pain
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 days prior to presentation. Patient experienced nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and anorexia. She was febrile to 103 earlier in the day. No prior similar symptoms reported. Emesis was nonbilious. Patient received 6 liters of NS for hypotension before transfer.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. FSGS - s/p living related kidney transplant complicated by rejection; recurrent UTI/pyelonephritis since recent transplant - chronic suppressive treatment with Bactrim. 2. Hypertension. 3. History of C-sections. 4. Tubal ligation.
